intro: Bulbostylis capillaris var. genuina, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often forming dense mats near water bodies. Its flowering stems are slender and often bear small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
